qas.question: In what year did AFL games temporarily cease to be broadcast on NFL Network?
Why did the temporary cessation of game broadcasts occur?
Why did the NFL Network begin to broadcast games again?
On what day was an AFL game broadcast live on NFL Network?
At what time of day was an AFL game shown on Fridays on NFL Network?

context: The NFL Network ceased airing Arena Football League games partway through the <a0_0>2012<a0_0/> season as a result of <a1_0>ongoing labor problems<a1_0/> within the league. Briefly, the games were broadcast on a tape delay to prevent the embarrassment that would result should the players stage a work stoppage immediately prior to a scheduled broadcast. (In at least once incidence this actually happened, resulting in a non-competitive game being played with replacement players, and further such incidents were threatened.) Once <a2_0>the labor issues were resolved<a2_0/>, the NFL Network resumed the practice of broadcasting a live <a3_0>Friday<a3_0/> <a4_0>night<a4_0/> game. NFL Network dropped the league at the end of the 2012 season.
